backend

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • backend.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a player of the monopoly game. It has necessary fields to hold the possesions of a player. It also implements the functions needed by his actions.
    Version:
    %I%, %G%
    Author:
    Utku Evci

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor that creates an instance of a player

              int balance,

        Parameters:
        playerNo - that indicates the player number
        userName - indicates the name of the player
        balance - indicates the initial balance of the player
        location - initial square of the player in the board
        Modifies:
        this.

        Requires:
        that the sq is not null

      • buySquareWithPrice

        public void buySquareWithPrice(buyableSquare sq,
                               int price)
        This function is called when the player wants to buys a square with a specific price. This function checks the balance of the player to see whether the player has enough money.
        Parameters:
        sq - the square that the player intends the buy
        price - the price that the player intends the buy the square for
        Requires:
        that the sq is not null

      • buySquareWithPriceDebug

        public void buySquareWithPriceDebug(buyableSquare sq,
                                    int price)
        This function is called by the save/load/debug functions of the monopoly game. The only difference is that it doesn't update the GUI views.
        Parameters:
        sq - the square that the player intends the buy
        price - the price that the player intends the buy the square for
        Requires:
        that the sq is not null

        public boolean canBuyCurrentSquare()

        Returns:

        Gives money without checking the balance.
        Parameters:

        Requires:
        the balance is more than the amount.

      • givePayment

        public void givePayment(int amount,
                        Player receiver,
                        Game g)
        Gives money when it is given to a player with checking the balance. If not enough balance exist then makes the player sell or the player go bankrupt.
        Parameters:
        amount - of the money given.
        receiver - of the money to be given.
        g - the game player is in.
        Requires:
        the receiver and game is not null

      • givePayment

        public void givePayment(int amount,
                        Game g)
        Gives money to the game with checking the balance. If not enough balance exist then makes the player sell or the player go bankrupt.
        Parameters:
        amount - of the money given.
        g - the game player is in.
        Requires:
        the game is not null

      • transferMoney

        public void transferMoney(Player receiver,
                          int amount,
                          Game g)
        Calls the givePayment method of this player and the other player receives the money afterwards.
        Parameters:
        amount - of the money given.
        receiver - of the money to be transfered
        g - the game player is in.
        Requires:
        the receiver and game is not null

      • checkBankrupcy

        public void checkBankrupcy(int amount,
                           Player receiver,
                           Game g)
        Checks if the player is bankrupt. If so it does bankrupt the player by transfering his assests to the receiver. Receiver null means the player owes to the game
        Parameters:
        amount - of the money given.
        receiver - of the money to be given.
        g - the game player is in.
        Requires:
        the receiver and game is not null
        Modifies:
        The receiver and THIS and appropriate Squares and Cards.

      • isEnoughMoneyExist

        public boolean isEnoughMoneyExist(int amountNeeded)
        Compares the given amount with the player's balance.
        Parameters:
        amountNeeded - the amount to be compared
        Returns:
        true if enough money exists, otherwise false.
        Requires:
        the receiver and game is not null

      • getbuyableLocation

        public buyableSquare getbuyableLocation()
        If the current location is a buyable square it does return the location as a buyableSquare
        Returns:
        the casted location of the player.

      • move2SquareWithTarget

        public void move2SquareWithTarget(Square targetSq,
                                  Game g)
        Moves to the given square by passing any other square on the way and calling their passing_procs. Finally it do call the target square's arrival_proc.
        Parameters:
        targetSq - Square to be arrived
        g - The game that the player is in.
        Requires:
        that the given square is not null
        Modifies:
        the player THIS,The square given as input.

      • move2SquareWithDice

        public void move2SquareWithDice(Game g)
        Moves according to the dice by passing any other square on the way and calling their passing_procs. Finally it do call the target square's arrival_proc.
        Parameters:
        g - The game that the player is in.
        Requires:
        that the game is not null
        Modifies:
        the player THIS,The square given as input.
